page.title: 01Living in Frizinghall
page.content: Living in Frizinghall. Life in Manningham is great,there are lots of shops close by selling fish and chips,newspapers,hardware,videos plus three minimarkets,one betting shop and a post office. Nighat's family owns a shop, they sold clothes and shoes but now they sell drinks, food,fruit and even beer.There are playing fields,a football pitch (not very big!) and a cricket ground.At school Muslim girls must wear trousers to cover their legs - most white girls have got used to the Muslim ways but they no longer ask them to parties because they know they will not be allowed to go.Sometimes white girls wear the Muslim style of clothes and try to learn Punjabi.Zartashia's home is special to her because her family all love each other,they work together and welcome people to share their home
